Articles.Content:
I designed this vessel last week, inspired a little from Aliens movie since I needed to lift some fuel from point A to B on moon,

I've managed to optimize the vessel after few hours of trial and errors, now it's able to lift cargoes up to 27 tonnes (93t 1.63 TWR), and reacts pretty good with Vernor engines in manuevering wise, just dont forget to swith Control Point to the docking port above, since engines are down-ward,

Having KAS winch adds much to it, otherwise having only cargo bay doesnt make up for it, I've managed to ferry and old lander and two T-400 fuel tanks easily,

Download: http://www./download/tx1u36mu061384t/Shuttle_Mk_2_Stk.craft

Welcome to the forums!

Are the air intakes just for aesthetic effect?

Edited June 6, 2015 by Ojimak
looks nice, but ksp tells me not stock...

looks nice, but ksp tells me not stock...
I think it has the KAS Winch on it as he mentioned using it in the post.

looks nice, but ksp tells me not stock...

My bad, I forgot one "refueling" connector below the tank, I removed it and tried without the KAS/KIS, it should be stock now, sorry..

Welcome to the forums!

Are the air intakes just for aesthetic effect?

Thank you

Yes, intakes are there for only aesthetics,

And the cockpit in front is angled considerably, another eye-candy, so piloting should be done from either cockpit in behind, or from the upper docking port, to fully control vertical engines/layout

My bad, I forgot one "refueling" connector below the tank, I removed it and tried without the KAS/KIS, it should be stock now, sorry..

Stock still won't load it. Says "light-area-01" is an invaild part. I don't know what mod that is. I edited the craft file by hand to remove those parts and references to them and it loads now. Not sure it changed much, maybe just the craft lighting?
